title: Solar Wind Compressibility
subtitle: How density fluctuations regulate helium
description: Hydrogen compressibility (density fluctuations) is the primary regulator of helium abundance saturation in the solar wind. When compressibility drops below 9%, helium saturates at a universal value regardless of speed or Alfvénicity. This incompressibility threshold provides a powerful diagnostic for identifying solar wind source regions.

related_figures.relevance: Shows universal saturation below 15% compressibility threshold
Reveals dual role of compressibility in mean abundance vs variability

related_topics.connection: Compressibility regulates when helium reaches saturation

paper.title: On the Regulation of the Solar Wind Helium Abundance by the Hydrogen Compressibility
